turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, my Wi-Fi router just completely died. No lights, nothing. I need help getting it back online, this is so inconvenient!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I'm sorry to hear you're having trouble with your router. Losing internet access is definitely frustrating. Let's try to figure this out. Can you tell me the make and model of your router, please?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's a Netgear Nighthawk, model R7000. It was working fine yesterday, and now it's just... dead. I already tried unplugging it and plugging it back in, but that didn't do anything.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you for providing the model information. Since you've already tried a power cycle, let's check the power source. Can you confirm that the power adapter is securely plugged into both the router and a working electrical outlet? Sometimes trying a different outlet can help.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, it's plugged in firmly. And the outlet works, I tested it with a lamp. What if the power adapter itself is broken? How can I even test that? I don't have a multimeter or anything like that. Is there a typical lifespan for these things?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a good point about the power adapter. While testing it without specialized equipment is difficult, power adapter failures can occasionally happen, though they don't have a strict 'lifespan' like a battery. Since there are absolutely no lights on the router, even after a power cycle and confirming the outlet, it strongly suggests either the power adapter or the router's power circuitry has failed. Do you have a spare power adapter from another device with the same voltage and connector size?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, I don't think I have a matching spare adapter just lying around. This is really annoying, I can't work without internet! So it sounds like it's either the power cord or the router itself is toast? Is there anything else at all I can try before I have to go buy a new one?
